column4: How do I get GIMP to do... anything at all but segfault? Running Kubuntu 11.04.
installing from apt-get install gimp
fix your memory
crashes immediately in startup, if it was that bad a mammary error, it'd effect other apps...
one would think
mv ~/.gimp-2.6 ~/.gimp-2.6-backup && sudo apt-get install --reinstall gimp
i.e., before gui even.. total exec time is 840 ms start to crash -_-'
It doesn't get far enough to create the .gimp dir. Waiting on the reinstall now
Yeh, still segfaults after the reinstall :/
install the gimp-dbg package and run it with gdb. See where it crashes
also, pastebin the output of 'apt-cache policy gimp'
http://paste.ubuntu.com/660072/ , also, how do I run it in gdb?
gdb gimp
http://paste.ubuntu.com/660073/ , but appearently missing symbols for..something
you need the libgtk2.0-0-dbgsym package
http://paste.ubuntu.com/660075/
do you have a .gtkrc with crap in it?
can you run 'strace -f gimp', maybe it's trying to parse a broken configfile and hitting a bug
http://paste.ubuntu.com/660080/
it looks related to your theme, it crashes when initializing parts of it
Yeh, indeed I just found that. It was set to Oxygen, I changed it to the only other, Raleigh- Someone should probably put a workaround bug or somethng for that..
Thanks for the help tracking it down
np
